verses.roman:
tumi ta' īśvara, tomāra āche sarva-śakti
saṅkṣepa-rūpe kaha tumi śunite haya mati

synonyms: tumi ta'—indeed You are; īśvara—the Supreme Lord; tomāra—of You; āche—there are; sarva-śakti—all potencies; saṅkṣepa-rūpe—briefly; kaha—please explain; tumi—You; śunite haya mati—I wish to hear.
translation: "You are the Supreme Personality of Godhead, and therefore You have inconceivable energies. I wish to hear from You briefly about the Brahma-sūtra."

purport.content: Prakāśānanda Sarasvatī said that he had already understood Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu's explanation of the direct import of Brahma-sūtra. Nonetheless, he was requesting the Lord to briefly give the purpose and purport of the Brahma-sūtra, the Vedānta-sūtra.
